prefix: Approach the following question the way someone with a PhD in biology would.
problem_prompt:
Approach the following question the way someone with a PhD in biology would. A rectangular loop of dimensions 3.0 m x 1.0 m carries a current of 2 A. What is the magnitude of the magnetic field at the center of the loop? Additionally, please select the option from the given choices that you believe is closest to the correct answer! (Please note that the following content involves constants might be used in the calculations : \mu_0 = 1.26 * 10^(-6) V·s/(A·m)

A. 7.54 x 10^(-7) Tesla
B. 1.73 x 10^(-7) Tesla
C. 3.54 x 10^(-7) Tesla
D. 7.35 x 10^(-7) Tesla

Answer:
